Summary In my current role at Google, I focus on product strategy, early-stage business development and strategic partnerships across Google's $XB suite of shopping products and services, including our ad products (e.g., Product Ads and its current variants, Local Inventory Ads and Purchases on Google), our trust services (e.g., Trusted Stores, Seller Ratings and our mystery-shopping service) and our nascent fulfillment efforts (e.g., Shopping Express). In short, I incubate new products and scale existing products through partnerships.  
 
I joined Google in August 2010 as part of its acquisition of virtual goods monetization company, Jambool, where I served as VP, Business and Legal Affairs. Prior to Jambool, I spent 9 years at Yahoo! in senior legal and business development roles, focused on search, shopping, local and travel. I earned my BA in English Literature and Communication Studies from UCLA and my JD from Villanova University School of Law.
